intro: Raphionacme dyeri, commonly known as the mountain dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Raphionacme dyeri is often found in open, sunny areas such as meadows and slopes.
